verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered, <WH6030>
"In truth <WH551> I know <WH3045> that this is so, <WH3651> But how <WH4100> can a man <WH582> be in the right <WH6663> before <WH5973> God <WH410>?
"If <WH518> one wished <WH2654> to dispute <WH7378> with Him, He could not answer <WH6030> Him once <WH259> in a thousand <WH505> [times.]
"Wise <WH2450> in heart <WH3824> and mighty <WH533> in strength, <WH3581> Who <WH4310> has defied <WH7185> <WH413> Him without <WH9608> harm <WH9608>?
"[It is God] who removes <WH6275> the mountains, <WH2022> they know <WH3045> not [how,] When <WH834> He overturns <WH2015> them in His anger; <WH639>
Who shakes <WH7264> the earth <WH776> out of its place, <WH4725> And its pillars <WH5982> tremble; <WH6426>
Who commands <WH559> the sun <WH2775> not to shine, <WH2224> And sets <WH2856> a seal <WH2856> upon the stars; <WH3556>
Who alone <WH905> stretches <WH5186> out the heavens, <WH8064> And tramples <WH1869> down <WH1869> the waves <WH1116> of the sea; <WH3220>
Who makes <WH6213> the Bear, <WH5906> Orion, <WH3685> and the Pleiades, <WH3598> And the chambers <WH2315> of the south; <WH8486>
Who does <WH6213> great <WH1419> things, <WH1419> unfathomable <WH2714>, <WH369> <WH5704> And wondrous <WH6381> works <WH6381> without <WH5704> <WH369> number. <WH4557>
"Were He to pass <WH5674> by me, I would not see <WH7200> Him; Were He to move <WH2498> past <WH2498> [me,] I would not perceive <WH995> Him.
"Were He to snatch <WH2862> away, <WH2862> who <WH4310> could restrain <WH7725> Him? Who <WH4310> could say <WH559> to Him, 'What <WH4100> art Thou doing <WH6213>?'
"God <WH433> will not turn <WH7725> back <WH7725> His anger; <WH639> Beneath <WH8478> Him crouch <WH7817> the helpers <WH5826> of Rahab. <WH7293>
"How <WH637> then <WH637> <WH3588> can I answer <WH6030> Him, [And] choose <WH977> my words <WH1697> before <WH5973> Him?
"For though <WH518> I were right, <WH6663> I could not answer; <WH6030> I would have to implore <WH2603> the mercy <WH2603> of my judge. <WH8199>
"If <WH518> I called <WH7121> and He answered <WH6030> me, I could not believe <WH539> that He was listening <WH238> to my voice. <WH6963>
"For He bruises <WH7779> me with a tempest, <WH8183> And multiplies <WH7235> my wounds <WH6482> without <WH2600> cause. <WH2600>
"He will not allow <WH5414> me to get <WH7725> my breath, <WH7307> But saturates <WH7646> me with bitterness. <WH4472>
"If <WH518> [it is a matter] of power, <WH3581> behold, <WH2009> [He is] the strong <WH533> one! <WH533> And if <WH518> [it is a matter] of justice, <WH4941> who <WH4310> can summon <WH3259> Him?
"Though <WH518> I am righteous, <WH6663> my mouth <WH6310> will condemn <WH7561> me; Though I am guiltless, <WH8535> He will declare <WH6140> me guilty. <WH6140>
"I am guiltless; <WH8535> I do not take <WH3045> notice <WH3045> of myself; <WH5315> I despise <WH3988> my life. <WH9132>
"It is [all] one; <WH259> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> I say, <WH559> 'He destroys <WH3615> the guiltless <WH8535> and the wicked. <WH7563>'
"If <WH518> the scourge <WH7752> kills <WH4191> suddenly, <WH6597> He mocks <WH3932> the despair <WH9275> of the innocent. <WH9345>

"The earth <WH776> is given <WH5414> into the hand <WH3027> of the wicked; <WH7563> He covers <WH3680> the faces <WH6440> of its judges. <WH8199> If <WH518> [it is] not [He,] then <WH645> who <WH4310> is it?
"Now my days <WH3117> are swifter <WH7043> than <WH4480> a runner; <WH7323> They flee <WH1272> away, <WH1272> they see <WH7200> no <WH3808> good. <WH9186>
"They slip <WH2498> by like <WH5973> reed <WH16> boats, <WH591> Like an eagle <WH5404> that swoops <WH2907> on its prey. <WH400>
"Though <WH518> I say, <WH559> 'I will forget <WH7911> my complaint, <WH7879> I will leave <WH5800> off my [sad] countenance <WH6440> and be cheerful, <WH1082>'
I am afraid <WH3025> of all <WH3605> my pains, <WH6094> I know <WH3045> that Thou wilt not acquit <WH5352> me.
"I am accounted wicked, <WH7561> Why <WH4100> then <WH2088> should I toil <WH3021> in vain <WH1892>?
"If <WH518> I should wash <WH7364> myself with snow <WH7950> And cleanse <WH2141> my hands <WH3709> with lye, <WH1253>
Yet <WH227> Thou wouldst plunge <WH2881> me into the pit, <WH7845> And my own clothes <WH8008> would abhor <WH8581> me.
"For [He is] not a man <WH376> as I am that I may answer <WH6030> Him, That we may go <WH935> to court <WH4941> together. <WH9191>
"There <WH3426> is no <WH3808> umpire <WH3198> between <WH996> us, Who may lay <WH7896> his hand <WH3027> upon us both. <WH8147>
"Let Him remove <WH5493> His rod <WH7626> from me, And let not dread <WH367> of Him terrify <WH1204> me.
"[Then] I would speak <WH1696> and not fear <WH3372> Him; But I am not like <WH3651> that in myself.
